metadata.Title: CVE-2018-6132 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Certified (bionic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Uninitialized data in WebRTC in Google Chrome prior to 67.0.3396.62 allowed a remote attacker to obtain potentially sensitive information from process memory via a crafted video file.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-6132` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

chromium-browser - 67.0.3396.99-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
chromium-browser-l10n - 67.0.3396.99-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
chromium-chromedriver - 67.0.3396.99-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg - 67.0.3396.99-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg-extra - 67.0.3396.99-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: chromium-browser package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '67.0.3396.99-0ubuntu0.18.04.1').
